remarks: Combine the results of ~ dvlip and ~ dvlipcn into one.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Mar-2015.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 8-Sep-2015.)
statement:
dvlip2.s $e |- ( ph -> S e. { RR , CC } ) $.
dvlip2.j $e |- J = ( ( abs o. - ) |` ( S X. S ) ) $.
dvlip2.x $e |- ( ph -> X C_ S ) $.
dvlip2.f $e |- ( ph -> F : X --> CC ) $.
dvlip2.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. S ) $.
dvlip2.r $e |- ( ph -> R e. RR* ) $.
dvlip2.b $e |- B = ( A ( ball ` J ) R ) $.
dvlip2.d $e |- ( ph -> B C_ dom ( S _D F ) ) $.
dvlip2.m $e |- ( ph -> M e. RR ) $.
dvlip2.l $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B ) -> ( abs ` ( ( S _D F ) ` x ) ) <_ M ) $.
dvlip2 $p |- ( ( ph /\ ( Y e. B /\ Z e. B ) ) -> ( abs ` ( ( F ` Y ) - ( F ` Z ) ) ) <_ ( M x. ( abs ` ( Y - Z ) ) ) ) $.
$d A x $.
$d B x $.
$d F x $.
$d J x $.
$d M x $.
$d R x $.
$d S x $.
$d Y x $.
$d Z x $.
$d ph x $.
